message.content: This question requires a basic understanding of the process of condensation. Condensation occurs when a gas (in this case, water vapor) that is in the air turns into a liquid as it comes into contact with a surface that is cooler than the dew point temperature. In an office building, the most likely example of condensation would be the beads of moisture that form on a cold can of root beer. Option (B) is incorrect because pens leaking ink is not an example of condensation. Option (C) is incorrect because the rising vapor from a cup of coffee is actually an example of evaporation, not condensation. Option (D) is incorrect because a sprinkler system is not directly related to condensation.

This question requires knowledge about the process of condensation and how it occurs in an office building. Condensation is the process of a gas changing into a liquid state. In an office building, one example of condensation would be the beads of water that form on a cold can of root beer. When the can is cold, the water vapor in the air around it comes into contact with the cold surface of the can and condenses into water droplets. Option (B) is incorrect because leaking ink is not an example of condensation. Option (C) is incorrect because the vapor rising from the coffee is not condensing into a liquid. Option (D) is unrelated to condensation, as it is referring to a sprinkler system above.

To answer this question, we must have a basic understanding of the process of condensation. Condensation occurs when a gas (in this case, water vapor) is cooled and changes into a liquid form. Among the options presented, the most likely example of condensation in an office building would be "the beads on a cold root beer can." This is because when a cold beverage is placed in a warmer environment, the air around it will cool the surface of the can. As a result, water vapor in the air will condense and form droplets on the surface of the can, creating the "beads." 

Option (B), the pens leaking ink, is not an example of condensation as it does not involve the change from a gas to a liquid. Option (C), the vapor rising from the coffee, is actually an example of evaporation, where liquid water changes into a gas. Option (D), the sprinkler system above, is also unrelated to condensation as it involves the distribution of water, not the change in its state. Therefore, the correct answer is (A).
